cyclone.name: BERYL
cyclone.current_location: about 925 miles ESE of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating west-northwest toward the Lesser Antilles, then expected to move into the eastern Caribbean and toward Hispaniola while weakening

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Dominica; Tropical Storm Watch for Martinique, Guadeloupe, St. Martin, St. Barthelemy
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Lesser Antilles from Guadeloupe south to St. Lucia, then portions of Puerto Rico and Hispaniola as the system tracks WNW
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (≥39 mph) are possible late Monday into early Tuesday with a 22 % cumulative chance of 34-kt winds and a 3 % chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected for the north coast of Puerto Rico given the small size of Beryl and its forecast passage south of the island.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring periods of heavy showers Monday–Tuesday; localized totals could approach 3–5 inches, especially over higher terrain.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated flash flooding and minor mud-slides in mountainous areas if heavy rain bands persist.
